name: Shanghai Villa
address: 144 W 4th St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Wonderful dumplings and good value for their lunch specials.  A hidden gem.

The flavors here create impressions that last longer than words. A masterclass in restaurant execution. Despite size constraints, this place stays busy. In addition, staff here displayed both warmth and willingness to help. Exceptional food, great service, and genuinely friendly employees!
What a lovely little spot! Great food, very reasonable prices, great atmosphere.

Shanghai Villa, is a great find for those who love simple, delicious food that doesn‚Äôt break the bank. The menu offers a variety of flavorful Chinese dishes made with fresh ingredients and just the right balance of seasoning. Portions are generous, and everything feels homemade yet thoughtfully prepared. The atmosphere is warm and unpretentious, perfect for a casual dinner with friends or a relaxed solo meal. Service is friendly and efficient, making the experience easy and enjoyable from start to finish. A spot that proves good food doesn‚Äôt have to be fancy or expensive to be memorable!
Bree is a blessing, helped us with our questions and was very nice! Been coming here for a while and the food is always good
I‚Äôve lived in Shanghai for 10 years, and I think this is very authentic, especially the mini wonton soup, it‚Äôs my favorite food!

I enjoyed this place completely. Each dish maintains its just-cooked quality. The title Shanghai Villa grabbed my attention immediately. Staff members excel at showing kindness. The restaurant offers original options!
whonton is pretty good and environment is super chill
Great experience

This used to be my favorite vegan place. I spent many holidays and birthdays here with friends when I lived in the Village.  While I'm glad that the current managers kept some vegan things on the menu, there is absolutely no way in hell I would sit next to someone eating slaughtered pig (or any other murdered animal). They clearly don't understand the customer base that went here for decades.
This place is a great restaurant i recommend the vegan menu
I like the food it was so good I enjoyed it

The kitchen knows exactly how to make taste buds happy. This restaurant transported us beyond ordinary dining experiences! The service team was equally attentive. Their food has personality in taste. This restaurant achieves perfect execution.
Good
Pretty chill place 100%
Great food!
Great xlb and friendly service. Lunch special is a good choice
My comfort foodü•∫taste exactly like my childhood

I had my first experience here through unplanned timing. The friendly atmosphere puts everyone at ease. The menu options all impress. The team shows genuine warmth to guests. You get what you pay for completely.

I found exactly the meal I was hoping for. Nothing here hides behind heavy sauces. This restaurant delivers what others only attempt. The team helps, stays humble, and maintains sincerity. Shanghai Villa shows excellence in all categories.
Really nice dumplings!
Great food and service! Definitely recommend!
Love it!!!!
This place was amazing! So clean and the best food. I totally recommend it to anyone
Pretty good. A old customer who came several time.
The food is very Shanghainese and delicious.
great Shanghai dishes
Great food. I ordered the soup dumplings and the dandan mien, and both were excellent.
cozy

I'm genuinely shocked by the quality here. The employees displayed both kindness and respectful treatment. Every item warrants highest marks. The waiters were helpful, food arrived promptly, and everything was well-cooked. Look into this place!

Servers anticipate needs while offering many tempting choices. You'll notice the excellent customer care and inviting feel. To add to the experience, the team was cordial and accommodating. Their dishes respect cultural culinary traditions. The place amazed me entirely.
Great for a family style group dinner. Lots of vegan options, especially recommend the kaofu appetizer and eggplant in garlic sauce.
Delicious food with quick service! The pork soup dumplings, yakisoba, and hot & sour soup were all full of flavor and really satisfying. Will definitely be back.
Great service!

The price point aligns with expectations. The personnel made us feel remarkably special. Their combinations surprise but satisfy. They've created visual interest without excess. I'll put this in my regular rotation.
Was in the area and gave it a try. Pretty authentic Shanghai flavors.

If you‚Äôre looking for food that passes as edible, go here. Google rates the food 10-20$ per person which is technically correct, but if you add their mediocre, dry rice they add an extra 10$ per bowl. I wish they‚Äôd told our party before ordering rice because typically a side of rice is under 5$; 10$ is just far too expensive for the quality. The food looked appetizing but was bland for taste; my party didn‚Äôt enjoy it at all. If you come as a group be prepared to Zelle or Venmo, they do not split checks and did not tell us before we ordered. It would have been better if they had also told us this beforehand because it caused trouble while paying. Our food also came out staggered and at worst late- While my party was finishing their meal, my food finally came. Overall it was perfectly mediocre food, but I would not come back to eat here again.
Very cozy atmosphere and friendly service!

Shanghai Villa is a fantastic family-owned restaurant with incredible food and genuinely kind people. The food is fresh, flavorful, and made with care. The family who runs it is incredibly kind and welcoming. Highly recommend supporting this wonderful small business!
Mediocre Chinese food, though the vegan menu is a plus.

I‚Äôve been coming here since before the name change, and it‚Äôs still one of my favorite spots for vegan Chinese food. The flavors hit every time, and the menu has a ton of great options. It‚Äôs nice to see they‚Äôve kept the same quality even with the new name. Super chill vibes, friendly staff, and always a solid meal. Definitely worth checking out if you‚Äôre into tasty plant-based food or otherwise the menu has something for everyone.
service very slow.. delivery drivers long time waiting restaurant.. always late delivery food.
The food is carefully prepared and flavorful. Worth the visit!
Great tasting stuffs
Upon entering the first thing you encounter are two white used cars salesmen chatting about AMD and NIVIDIA stocks.

My brother dad and I came into Shanghai Villa for dinner. It was spectacular. The soup dumplings were incredible. The explosion of flavor is undescribable. The orange chicken was prepared in a fried style that I cannot say I've had before but was better than anything I'd had before.
The people were very kind and the service was good.

This place is a DISASTER! Not only are the prices unreasonable but I ordered a garlic saut√© broccoli and only gave me dry broccoli as if they is supposed to be my dish. No rice, no nothing. I have to scrap the bottom of the container just to taste something. Never coming here again
The dim sum was delicious and the staff exceptionally friendly and attentive. Our entrees were good.

It was ordinary, except for the food, which was disappointing. Dipping sauce was very sweet, dumplings were gummy while the filling was hard to chew and fell apart. There was a shrimp shell in one of them. Scallion pancakes didn‚Äôt taste like much of anything.

We intended to go to a restaurant 2-3 lots down the road but it was packed and we didn't want to wait. So we walked back here and decided to try. We were impressed with the food and the service. Unbelievable that it was not busy.  The background music was calm and we could have a conversation. We enjoyed our dinner here so much and would definitely come back again.

Went back the second time and the waiter remembered us right away which is impressive.

went here during PRIDE üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàüï∫‚ú® so yummy!! üòã especially loved the scallion noodles üçú and veggies dumplings ü•ü.   included some pics below ‚¨áÔ∏è so you all can see just delicious it was! this placed saved me and my friends from HEAT EXHAUSTION, RAIN, and HUNGER.  shoutout shanghai villa, would def come again. üíã

Wir waren zum ersten Mal dort. Allen vorab gab es einen tollen Service der einen ber√§t und Empfehlungen ausspricht. Das Essen war super lecker. Wir haben einen Speise umsonst bekommen, die wohl ab 30 Dollar frei ist. Die Toiletten sind sehr sauber, ebenso die K√ºche. Wir haben rein Vegan gegessen. Das Orange Seitan Szechuan war Super lecker. Auch das Pad Thai. Klare Empfehlung. Ein Besuch lohnt sich. Au√üerdem ist es auch nicht sehr g√ºnstig. 3 Vorspeisen, 2 Getr√§nke und 2 Hauptgerichte f√ºr nur 68 Dollar.

we came here on new year's day and got not only the loveliest food but also the loveliest service!! every single dish we ordered was so delicious and even better than expected! highly recommend!!! üòÅ

Good place. If not for the loud people talking next to me, it would truly be Zen - the music was very relaxing and the lights were dim.

I had the dumplings and the Shanghai Seitan. Portions were decently sized but I was disappointed to find out that the main dish didn‚Äôt come with rice so I had to order that separately. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever been to an Asian restaurant where the dish didn‚Äôt come with a side lol.

Just a heads up, if you are a mushroom lover like me, don‚Äôt order the Shanghai Seitan, order the Oyster mushrooms with Chinese broccoli down the menu instead - they‚Äôre basically the same dish but one has seitan, and I only got two pathetic little pieces of mushrooms buried at the bottom under all the seitan and Chinese broccoli lol. The seitan was way too dry for my taste but it may be because I‚Äôm not used to eating fried foods.

I will definitely give this place another shot. Overall I enjoyed it as the food wasn‚Äôt overly salty or overly oily. Ginger Root on the Upper East Side is still my favorite spot for pan Asian food, but I think Go Zen will be alright for when I don‚Äôt have the time to go all the way up there.

UPDATE: Apparently this place is under new name and management now and apparently not 100% vegan anymore? Eww. The animals out there are only like 49% dead now, thanks guys!
I really like the vegetarian dim sum options. They have vegetarian soup dumplings. The soy sheets were my favourite though. The owner is very nice

This place deserves 5 stars. I was upset to see this restaurant empty on Saturday evening(((
Good service, polite staff, very quiet and clean place, good food, affordable prices.
Menu with photos.
I wish we can come here again)

Very nice little Asian restaurant with vegan food. The food tastes amazing and the portions are big (Not bodybuilder big) and the price is very reasonable and fair. The staff is very nice, courteous and kind. We would love to come again. Highly recommended.

This is the BEST and most underrated food establishment in all of NYC - no exaggeration. I used to live in NYC and go all the time and now every time I visit it is a MUST. One (of many) highlights is the vegan buffalo ‚Äúwings‚Äù which have the‚Ä¶

One of the best Asian vegan spots in New York.
Wide variety of choices. Ingredients seem fresh and it feels like the kitchen staff put a lot of care and preparation in the presentation of each dish.

Soup dumplings were tasty, perfect texture and exploded with juicy flavor.

‚ÄúSoy cutlet with teriyaki‚Äù
Soy cutlet has a great, easy to eat texture, nice taste, generous portions of mix veggies and the sauce is perfect, teriyaki but not too sweet or sugary.

The server was quite busy yet remained friendly,  and managed to remember our order perfectly.
Delicious, fast and friendly service. The soup dumplings were excellent and chili sauce wontons were just the right level of spicy for my sensitive pallet. So good!!
Popped into this place on a whim and did not regret it! Best soup dumplings I‚Äôve ever had but my favorite was the crispy pork buns! It is under new ownership and they are so lovely!
Great food. First time at vegan resturant i love it. Prices are reasonable. Amazing peanut butter cake. Highly recommend and the staff are very nice.

Go Zen is one of the best vegan restaurants around. There Pad Thai, sesame dish, and cheesecake are great. I will say that there Pad Thai is either the best or one of the best Pad Thais I have ever eaten whether it be vegan or not. The same goes for the cheesecake.

Prices are reasonable about 13 per person, just with entrees. Keep in mind their dishes are made to be shared.

The reason why I love their food so much is that the chef doesn‚Äôt cheat. The chef doesn‚Äôt use a huge amount of salt or sugar or oil to make you love the dish. The balance of flavors is blended just right so that you are hitting all the notes. For example, the cheesecake has an extremely creamy body that is sweet, but not too sweet. The raspberry on top gives it a little extra kick, while the decorative cream in the back  is not so much decorative, but a fundamental element to the whole dish.

Honestly, I think some people don‚Äôt go in because it is not crowded inside. In my opinion, you should just take that as getting to eat some of the best food without the wait.

Okay, this is place lives up to its name. Such a sweet and peaceful environment, and the staff were absolute sweethearts! I wasn‚Äôt expecting so many options to choose from but I have no doubt that everything else on the menu, is just as delicious as what I ordered. I got the No. 2 House Super Combo: the Beijing Seitan and it was amazing! The portions are fantastic and that baked meat pastry was such a nice little treat! Their beef with broccoli also brought me back to the classic Chinese takeout dish. I‚Äôm looking forward to going back, and trying those crispy mushroom caps!

Update review. The owner added non vegan options to cater to those people who aren‚Äôt vegan. This place used to be all vegan now it‚Äôs not. There‚Äôs a few vegan options left. A lot of the food I enjoyed aren‚Äôt on the menu anymore. One of the servers brought me what‚Äôs left of the old menu and I was able to order something familiar. I wish they kept the vegan menu they had before and just had a separate menu. You still get a big portion for the entre, but no more of the pick 3 options. I guess I can take my non vegan friends here for since they cater to them now too.

Authentic newly-opened Shanghainese restaurant in the west village. The owner and kitchen all speak Shanghainese. Not only you can find popular dishes like Xiao long bao and pan fried pork bun, there are many other less known dishes like ‚Äúsmall dumplings‚Äù. Service is warm and vibe is casual.

Wow! Came here for Jan 1st lunch and discovered that behind their unassuming storefront is some of the tastiest vegan food in NYC. We ordered the miso eggplant, the mushroom soup, wonton soup, soup dumplings, and tofu veg delight. Every dish was excellent and well-prepared. No overpowering sauces or overcooked vegetables. Just a nice array of fresh, wonderful flavors.

Oh, and the service was extremely friendly and welcoming. We‚Äôll be back!
Amazing staff and and amazing place. Is sad the place was empty on a saturday. I will welcome people to go and support this Restaurant as have amazing deals and to enjoy their menu.

Updates: Shanghai Villa now serves a full list of delicious and authentic Shanghainese/Chinese food! Service is excellent and food is impeccable!

You should definitely try the following dishes:
- Steam Soup Dumplings (Xiao Long Bao)
- Seared Pork Bun(Shen Jian Bao)
- Vege Bun
- Lion Head
- Sweet & Sour Pork
- Grandma‚Äôs Fish
This is place is amazing! The service from the staff, the food is so tasty, the establishment is so clean and cute.

Their food is a joke. I ordered Dandan mian and scallion oil noodles. Take a look at the pictures. The size is site size, no flavor whatsoever and of course no real ingredients other than soy sauce and oil and salt

My first ever vegan experience! Loved it.
It really wasn't bad at all.
Good place, simple but lovely food, good American sized portions. I left nearly half of my food behind because I couldn't finish it!
Good place!
Great place, food was delicious, I tried different plates with my kids, they are looking forward to going back, I will recommend.
A perfect place for healthy minded Asian cuisine downtown. I‚Äôve been a patron for several years and always enjoy the food. Gluten free and soy free options available on many dishes!

My brother and I were looking for a place to grab some vegan food for dinner, and this spot came up.

This place has an cozy, intimate vibe that is lacking in many restaurants these days. The service was great, the food came quickly. My water glass was literally never empty, which was awesome.

My brother got the sesame seitan, and I got the vege beef and broccoli. We shared both, and also shared steamed dumplings, and some rice paper sprout rolls.

The food was excellent. The prices are ridiculously fair. There was enough for us to take home as well.

There's a bit of everything on the menu too, so whether you want light fare, or something a bit heartier, you won't come up empty handed.

Definitely will go back, there's so many things on the menu that I need to try.

Ridiculously delicious. Crispy rolls! Sweet and Sour! Sesame Seitan! Mac and Cheese! Cream of broccoli soup! Smoothies!

If you stay within the realm of foods you find  tasty if cooked well, you will be handsomely rewarded. Whoever wrote the recipes or is whipping these meals together... Top Job!

What you see in the pics are green tea, Sesame Seitan with Kale, and Crispy Rolls.

I have been wanting to try soup dumplings for as long as I remember. I couldn‚Äôt find any halal soup dumplings in nyc. BUT BUT BHAAT!! I finally had them today and it was gooood üòç
Loved the music they played and the feeling of not being concerned about the halal/ haram ingredients! We just savored the food! ü•∞

We also got wonton soup which was delish, soy cashee saute and sweet sour devine!!  It was devine indeed!

Go Vegan Go! ! üëä

The food was simply amazing. I was initially hesitant because I am usually a meat fan but everything tastes so good and sometimes i could not tell the difference between the meat and vegan version. The prices are also quite reasonable and will definitely go again
My family and I dribbled upon this place thanksgiving evening and we had an amazing time and food. The food was delicious and vegan, the staff was so sweet and attentive.
